column3: Good catch. I'd slightly favor removing this completely, to adding another link (to a specific boost version) that might go stale as well.
Makes sense. Probably want to avoid URLs completely in all the docs?

ACK after squash, this should be one commit (see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits ).

> Makes sense. Probably want to avoid URLs completely in all the docs?

I don't think we'd want to be *that* drastic. Links can be very useful, especially if it explains something non-trivial. But this specific case is simply a link to a random blog post abo
@michaelfolkson ~~The latest commit 41d484d5c88f057e75cfdd8b88587b9a12a61744 seems a bit wrong. Could you verify?~~\n\nAh, _delete_ instead of _replace_.
ACK 41d484d5c88f057e75cfdd8b88587b9a12a61744.\n\nI'm sure anyone can find good documentation.
ACK 41d484d5c88f057e75cfdd8b88587b9a12a61744, the removed link is really obsolete.
